Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Violation_Type: Membership in organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's involvement with KDPI makes him inadmissible under sections 34(1)(b) and (f) of IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), sections 34(1)(b) and (f)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant was involved with KDPI, which engaged in violent actions against Iranian governments; reasonable grounds to believe membership and subversive activities
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Inadmissible due to membership in organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Division's decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; Division's decision upheld
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Involvement with KDPI, including alleged membership and participation in political activities
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Engagement in subversion by force through association with KDPI
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe membership and engagement in subversion by force
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature and extent of applicant’s involvement with KDPI
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision on admissibility
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Division's findings
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Division found reasonable grounds based on evidence presented
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Information on KDPI’s history of armed struggle and insurrections; applicant's admissions and affiliations
Crimes.Application_Basis: Membership in organization that engages in subversion by force
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Documentation and intelligence regarding KDPI’s violent activities and applicant’s role
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A person is inadmissible if they are a member of an organization that engages in subversion by force
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; sufficient evidence established reasonable grounds
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential threat to Canadian security due to association with violent organization
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's involvement with KDPI led to concerns about admissibility due to organization's violent actions
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evidence reviewed and assessed for credibility and relevance by Division
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No major issues; evidence deemed credible and sufficient
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Not applicable – applicant not yet admitted as permanent resident
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of Immigration Division to assess admissibility under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evidence supported conclusion of membership and subversive nature of KDPI
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: KDPI engaged in subversion by force; applicant was reasonably believed to be a member

Crimes.Crime_Name: Membership in an organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.National_Security_Element: Association with armed opposition group targeting foreign government
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Risk of harboring individuals linked to violent separatist movements
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: KDPI has engaged in armed struggle and insurrection against Iranian government
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Membership in organization using violence to subvert state authority
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Armed struggle, insurrections, attacks on government forces
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Participation in political activities associated with KDPI
Crimes.Leadership_Role: Not specified – no indication of leadership position
Crimes.Nature_of_Membership: Active political involvement, though exact role unclear
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, organizational records, applicant testimony
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Extent and nature of applicant’s actual membership and participation
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible enough to establish reasonable grounds for belief
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistency of statements, corroboration with known facts about KDPI
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Division accepted evidence as reliable for determining membership
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe membership in organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found applicant inadmissible due to KDPI membership
Crimes.Process: Admissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Right to present evidence and arguments before the Division
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged violation of Charter rights and fairness in process
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Claimant argued procedural unfairness but dismissed by court
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness of Division's interpretation and factual findings
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: None found; reasoning considered adequate and logical
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: High – inadmissibility may lead to removal proceedings

Crimes.Crime_Name: Subversion by force of a government
Crimes.Violation_Type: Engagement in or support of subversion by force
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether applicant is inadmissible under IRPA section 34(1)(b) due to involvement with KDPI
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 34(1)(b)
Crimes.Application_Facts: KDPI engaged in violent actions and armed struggles against Iranian government; applicant linked to KDPI
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant found inadmissible under IRPA section 34(1)(b)
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge inadmissibility finding
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Affiliation with KDPI, an organization conducting armed insurgency
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Involvement with organization that uses force to subvert government
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe engagement in subversion by force
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Evidence of KDPI’s violent campaigns and applicant’s ties
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Proper application of law and procedure in admissibility assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Findings supported by credible evidence of KDPI’s activities and applicant’s links
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Historical records of KDPI operations, reports of armed conflict, applicant’s affiliations
Crimes.Application_Basis: Involvement with organization engaging in subversion by force
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Publicly available information and intelligence on KDPI’s use of violence
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Engaging in or supporting subversion by force renders one inadmissible
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential risk to international peace and security through support of violent regime change
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant’s association with KDPI, which used force to subvert Iranian government
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evidence properly evaluated for reliability and relevance
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No material discrepancies or disputes over evidence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Jurisdiction of Immigration Division under IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evidence sufficient to meet legal threshold of reasonable grounds
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: KDPI’s actions constitute subversion by force; applicant connected to organization
